update.description:
Added video encoding functionality 

Added a toolbar button in gzclient for making videos 

Update: Renamed to VideoEncoder
update.title: video encoding with gui
update.reason: come back to this after VRC

content.raw: Thanks for the feedback guys. Unfortunately the pull request has to go. I made notes of it in issue #650
content.html: Thanks for the feedback guys. Unfortunately the pull request has to go. I made notes of it in issue #650

content.raw: Okay. We are getting side tracked. Ian, can you decline this pull-request and make a feature request on the issue tracker to revisit this pull-request after the VRC?
content.html: Okay. We are getting side tracked. Ian, can you decline this pull-request and make a feature request on the issue tracker to revisit this pull-request after the VRC?

content.raw:
The icons are currently based on png images, so it will just take some photoshop/gimp work to make it happen. I'm not sure how the grey ring around the data logger is generated, but here's two of the raw images:

[record.png](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/12e3ab1f1cc43a0f425792a0ed85f646e5e1e5ae/gazebo/gui/images/record.png?at=default)

[record_stop.png](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/12e3ab1f1cc43a0f425792a0ed85f646e5e1e5ae/gazebo/gui/images/record_stop.png?at=default)
content.html:
The icons are currently based on png images, so it will just take some photoshop/gimp work to make it happen. I'm not sure how the grey ring around the data logger is generated, but here's two of the raw images:

record.png

record_stop.png

content.raw:
Thanks, Steve :)

Agreed that it would be nice if the buttons looked more 3D. The grey border on the Logger record button is good, but might look better if it were thinner. What would be *really* cool is if we could add a bevel to the edge to really make it stand out from the screen. Is that possible?
content.html:
Thanks, Steve :)

Agreed that it would be nice if the buttons looked more 3D. The grey border on the Logger record button is good, but might look better if it were thinner. What would be really cool is if we could add a bevel to the edge to really make it stand out from the screen. Is that possible?

content.raw: @spaepcke Here's an image of what I'm talking about: ![record buttons](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/96660379/record%20buttons.png)
content.html: @spaepcke Here's an image of what I'm talking about:

content.raw: It's subjective, but I think the record button for the Data Logging gui looks better, because it has the thin ring of light grey between the red circle and the dark grey. The video record button would also benefit from some contrast, so that it looks like a button, not just a circle. What do you think @spaepcke ?
content.html: It's subjective, but I think the record button for the Data Logging gui looks better, because it has the thin ring of light grey between the red circle and the dark grey. The video record button would also benefit from some contrast, so that it looks like a button, not just a circle. What do you think @spaepcke ?

content.raw: I mentioned that above and then filed issue #645. I'd like to see the aspect ratio fixed, even if the user can't specify the frame sizes.
content.html: I mentioned that above and then filed issue #645. I'd like to see the aspect ratio fixed, even if the user can't specify the frame sizes.

content.raw: The aspect ratio is off in the recorded video. Is that easy to fix, or should this be a feature request?
content.html: The aspect ratio is off in the recorded video. Is that easy to fix, or should this be a feature request?

content.raw: Works. Thanks.
content.html: Works. Thanks.

content.raw: Is the width of the save dialog easy to fix or should I make this another issue?
content.html: Is the width of the save dialog easy to fix or should I make this another issue?

content.raw: The backtrace points to line 435 in Camera.cc which is the old code that uses `copyContentsToMemory()`. Can you update to the latest code, compile and try again? thanks.
content.html: The backtrace points to line 435 in Camera.cc which is the old code that uses copyContentsToMemory(). Can you update to the latest code, compile and try again? thanks.

update.description:
Added video encoding functionality 

Added a toolbar button in gzclient for making videos 

Update: Renamed to VideoEncoder
update.title: video encoding with gui

content.raw: Whoops, I think I suggested bad logic, this should be `OGRE_VERSION_MINOR < 8`
content.html: Whoops, I think I suggested bad logic, this should be OGRE_VERSION_MINOR < 8

content.raw: I used #ifdef's because copyContentsToMemory() should be more efficient than creating and rendering to a texture.  So ogre 1.8 users could get a slight speedup.
content.html: I used #ifdef's because copyContentsToMemory() should be more efficient than creating and rendering to a texture. So ogre 1.8 users could get a slight speedup.

content.raw: thanks, updated macro and added some information on this problem and the change between ogre 1.7 and 1.8 that causes this
content.html: thanks, updated macro and added some information on this problem and the change between ogre 1.7 and 1.8 that causes this

update.description:
Added video encoding functionality 

Added a toolbar button in gzclient for making videos 

Update: Renamed to VideoEncoder
update.title: video encoding with gui

content.raw: Maybe a link to documentation isn't necessary, but at least include a comment about how it works fine in testing with 1.8, but there are observed problems with earlier versions.
content.html: Maybe a link to documentation isn't necessary, but at least include a comment about how it works fine in testing with 1.8, but there are observed problems with earlier versions.

content.raw:
What is the OGRE change that caused this? Perhaps we should have a link to some documentation or something. #ifdef's are always kinda intimidating.

Will this logic need to be changed when ogre gets to 2.0? Maybe it could be reversed:
~~~
#if OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR <= 8
...
#else
this->viewport->getTarget()->copyContentsToMemory(box);
#endif
~~~
content.html:
What is the OGRE change that caused this? Perhaps we should have a link to some documentation or something. #ifdef's are always kinda intimidating.

Will this logic need to be changed when ogre gets to 2.0? Maybe it could be reversed:

#if OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR <= 8
...
#else
this->viewport->getTarget()->copyContentsToMemory(box);
#endif

content.raw: I suspect its related to ogre's copyContentsToMemory call which caused previously seen crashes. I modified the code to use the old render texture blitToMemory method during a Camera post render.
content.html: I suspect its related to ogre's copyContentsToMemory call which caused previously seen crashes. I modified the code to use the old render texture blitToMemory method during a Camera post render.

content.raw: I removed that ogre call in b6eafe9. Looks like it happens on ogre-1.7.4 and not 1.8.1 which is what I am using
content.html: I removed that ogre call in b6eafe9. Looks like it happens on ogre-1.7.4 and not 1.8.1 which is what I am using

content.raw: I moved it out to its own class in b6eafe9
content.html: I moved it out to its own class in b6eafe9

content.raw: thanks for filing the issue, since we're not going to be using this for the competition, I'll leave that for later.
content.html: thanks for filing the issue, since we're not going to be using this for the competition, I'll leave that for later.

update.description:
Added video encoding functionality 

Added a toolbar button in gzclient for making videos 

Update: Renamed to VideoEncoder
update.title: video encoding with gui

content.raw: I filed this as a feature request: issue #645.
content.html: I filed this as a feature request: issue #645.

content.raw: issue #642
content.html: issue #642

content.raw: MainWindow is getting quite large, how hard would it be to split the record video gui functionality out of MainWindow?
content.html: MainWindow is getting quite large, how hard would it be to split the record video gui functionality out of MainWindow?

content.raw: Can you make this a feature request?
content.html: Can you make this a feature request?

content.raw:
In addition to ogv, mp4, and avi, it would be nice to offer saving the raw camera images as a sequence of png images. I know there are plugins to do this, but it would be cool to have it available from this interface. They should be named sequentially:
~~~
cameraName_timeStamp_1.png
cameraName_timeStamp_2.png
cameraName_timeStamp_3.png
etc.
~~~
content.html:
In addition to ogv, mp4, and avi, it would be nice to offer saving the raw camera images as a sequence of png images. I know there are plugins to do this, but it would be cool to have it available from this interface. They should be named sequentially:

cameraName_timeStamp_1.png
cameraName_timeStamp_2.png
cameraName_timeStamp_3.png
etc.

content.raw: It looks like the video size is hard-coded to 1024x768, but this makes the images distorted if the window has a different aspect ratio. At a minimum, we should maintain the aspect ratio so the videos don't look distorted, and power users might want to set the image size themselves.
content.html: It looks like the video size is hard-coded to 1024x768, but this makes the images distorted if the window has a different aspect ratio. At a minimum, we should maintain the aspect ratio so the videos don't look distorted, and power users might want to set the image size themselves.

content.raw:
I've gotten an intermittent seg-fault two times when clicking the record button in a certain sequence, though it doesn't always happen. I have one backtrace.

1. open gazebo
2. insert double pendulum model, watch it swing
3. pause simulation
4. reset world
5. step once to show the pendulum back at its initial position
6. click record

Here's a [backtrace showing the output after I clicked record](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/96660379/video-encoding-sef-fault-backtrace.txt), and I also have a [backtrace for all threads](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/96660379/video-encoding-sef-fault-backtrace-all-threads.txt).
content.html:
I've gotten an intermittent seg-fault two times when clicking the record button in a certain sequence, though it doesn't always happen. I have one backtrace.

  1. open gazebo
  2. insert double pendulum model, watch it swing
  3. pause simulation
  4. reset world
  5. step once to show the pendulum back at its initial position
  6. click record

Here's a backtrace showing the output after I clicked record, and I also have a backtrace for all threads.

content.raw: The first save dialog that comes up is not wide enough to display the full filename for me.
content.html: The first save dialog that comes up is not wide enough to display the full filename for me.

content.html: fixed in a2605ce

content.raw: Good suggestion.
content.html: Good suggestion.

content.raw: My first thought when I see a file named Encoder.[hh/cc] is that it is a joint angle sensor. It's maybe a bit picky on my part, but it would be more clearly named as VideoEncoder.
content.html: My first thought when I see a file named Encoder.[hh/cc] is that it is a joint angle sensor. It's maybe a bit picky on my part, but it would be more clearly named as VideoEncoder.
